p: With higher polarity and closely related chromatographic and spectroscopic features to 4-O- β-D-glucopyranosyl-2-hydroxy-6-methoxyacetophenone ( 4), compound 5 was obtained. According to the negative mode of ESIMS, a pseudo molecular ion peak was exhibited at m/ z = 489 [M−H], revealing the presence of rhamnose as additional sugar moiety. In accordance, the 1H NMR and 13C NMR spectra of compound 5 showed the same aromatic pattern of 4, however, with additional sugar unit of α-configuration ( J = 1.7 Hz) due to the presence of a doublet anomeric proton (H-1′') at δ 4.71 and corresponding anomeric carbon C-1′' at δ 101.7, reflecting the α-configuration nature of this sugar moiety having a doublet ( J = 6.0 Hz) methyl signal at δ 1.20 (H 3-6′', δ C: 16.5).
